title: No app-based cabs on Delhi roads today?
text: No app-based cabs on Delhi roads today? No app-based cabs on Delhi roads today? "More than 5,000 drivers are going to participate in the strike and we will ensure that app-based taxis don't ply," said Rathore.An Ola representative declined to comment. TNN | Updated: Feb 10, 2017, 09.44 AM IST (Representative image) NEW DELHI: A union claiming to represent a section of drivers working with app-based taxi services has called for a strike on February 10, in protest against what it described as "low fares and lack of basic amenities" from these companies. The strike is scheduled to include a march from Ramlila Maidan to Jantar Mantar from 7am onwards, followed by a dharna at Jantar Mantar, said Ravi Rathore , vice president of the Sarvodaya Driver Association of Delhi . "More than 5,000 drivers are going to participate in the strike and we will ensure that app-based taxis don't ply," said Rathore. An Ola representative declined to comment. Uber's spokesperson couldn't be reached.
